title: Why is it significantly important for teachers to know their learner (zone of proximal development) when designing a scaffolding technique in the writing classroom? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you know what “scaffolding” is, and what “zone of proximal development” means, that’s a trivial question. If you don’t know, get to work reading your text and/or lecture notes. If those don’t help, Google. Teachers are responsible for modeling behavior that looks for and finds information. Teachers who don’t know how to look for and find information are useless at every educational level.
